alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Gladwin; Kalkaska; Missaukee; Ogemaw; Oscoda; Roscommon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 10:53PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gladwin, Crawford, western Ogemaw, Roscommon, southeastern Kalkaska, Missaukee and southwestern Oscoda Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1052 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Morey to 7 miles southeast of Marion to near Lakeview. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Morey and Vogel Center around 1100 PM EDT. Moddersville and Moorestown around 1110 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Roscommon Township, Houghton Lake, Prudenville, Grayling, Roscommon County Airport, Lake St. Helen, South Higgins Lake, St. Helen, Hartwick Pines State Park and Roscommon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Crawford; Gladwin; Kalkaska; Missaukee; Ogemaw; Oscoda; Roscommon
